definition: to become fashionable/to catch on/to be popular

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
pass like thunder and move like the wind (idiom); swift and decisive reaction
to be popular for a while/to be all the rage for a time

sentences.english: She said that memorizing the words of English songs helped a little.
sentences.chinese: 她说记风行歌曲歌词也有点帮忙。

sentences.english: You will surprise everyone with your no nonsense approach to life and everything you do.
sentences.chinese: 你对生活和工作雷厉风行的态度让每个人都感到惊奇。

sentences.english: Yes. Probably the most popular is Mah-jong, a game played by four people.
sentences.chinese: 有，最风行的可能算麻将了，一种四个人玩的游戏。

sentences.english: thousands and thousands of people got infected with flu every year.
sentences.chinese: 每年不可胜数的人遭到风行性感冒感染。

sentences.english: Copycatting Culture is largely emerging on the internet, and should we follow or force it our?
sentences.chinese: 当“山寨文化”风行网络，我们是追捧还是打杀？

sentences.english: The pop song is popular in the populous city.
sentences.chinese: 这尾盛行歌直在生齿浓密的都会风行。

sentences.english: During this period, house churches boomed in popularity.
sentences.chinese: 在这段时期，家庭教会在中国遍地开花并风行一时。

sentences.english: Thus I say that when a command is promulgated, an order issued, its credibility will extend throughout the state.
sentences.chinese: 所以说，号令一经发出，就必须取信于民而风行全国。

sentences.english: The result of this flurry of activity was a significant simplification of the specification.
sentences.chinese: 这次雷厉风行的行动使这个规范显著简化。

sentences.english: Petanque is a popular sport in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 滚球是香港很风行的一项运动。

sentences.english: Simulated Culture is largely emerging on the internet, and should we follow or force it our?
sentences.chinese: 当“山寨文化”风行网络，我们是追捧还是打杀？

sentences.english: This style of writing has had a great vogue.
sentences.chinese: 这种写作风格曾大为风行。

sentences.english: Take advantage of an opportunity and be and strategic lead is faddish and consistent style actually.
sentences.chinese: 顺势而为和战略超前实际上是风行一贯的作风。

sentences.english: It has been popularized in both North America and Europe over the past 200 years.
sentences.chinese: 在过去两百年来则风行于北美和欧洲两地。

sentences.english: Board games started in Germany. They are popular in Europe and America for decades.
sentences.chinese: 桌上游戏发源于德国，在欧美地区已经风行了几十年。

sentences.english: Boho prints, floral patterns are all the rage in dresses and skirts.
sentences.chinese: 波希米亚印花，花朵及图形在女装和裙子上风行一时。

definition: ancient name for go (Chinese board game)
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear
ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements
